EVJ.Q: What is the global maximum heat value in the heatmap?
EVJ.A: The global maximum heat value is {0.98}.

EVJ.Q: What is the global minimum heat value in the heatmap?
EVJ.A: The global minimum heat value is {0.04}.

EVJ.Q: What is the maximum heat value of label Planning on the x-axis?
EVJ.A: The maximum heat value of Planning on the x-axis is {0.95}.

EVJ.Q: What is the maximum heat value for label Labor on the y-axis?
EVJ.A: The maximum heat value for Labor on the y-axis is {0.70}.

SC.Q: What is the average heat value for label Intermodal on the x-axis?
SC.A: The average heat value for Intermodal on the x-axis is {0.51}.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Maritime and Capacity or the cell corresponding to Maritime and Sustainability?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Maritime} and {Capacity} has a higher heat value.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Intermodal and Cost or the cell corresponding to Last Mile and Sustainability?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Last Mile} and {Sustainability} has a higher heat value.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Warehousing and Capacity or the cell corresponding to Last Mile and Sustainability?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Warehousing} and {Capacity} has a higher heat value.

MSR.Q: In the heatmap, what are the row and column labels for all cells whose heat values fall within the range of 0.08 to 0.30?
MSR.A: The cells are: {(Air, Capacity), (Maritime, Capacity), (Last Mile, Compliance), (Maritime, Compliance), (Customs, Cost), (Last Mile, Cost), (Customs, Labor), (Last Mile, Labor), (Warehousing, Labor), (Customs, Safety), (Last Mile, Safety), (Warehousing, Safety), (Warehousing, Sustainability)}.
